src.pebm_pkg¶

src.pebm_pkg.Preprocessing¶

class src.pebm_pkg.Preprocessing.Preprocessing(signal, fs)[source]¶

Bases: object

The purpose of the Preprocessing class is to prepare the ECG signal for the analysis. The class contains functions to filter the ECG signal from artifacts, the function to estimate the quality of the ECG signal -bsqi, and epltd peak detector.

Parameters

  • signal – the ECG signal as a ndarray.

  • fs – the frequency of the signal.

bpfilt()[source]¶

The bpfilt function applies a bandpass filter between [0.67, 100] Hz, this function uses a zero-phase Butterwarth filter with 75 coefficients. :return:

bsqi(peaks=None)[source]¶
This function is based on the following paper:

Li, Qiao, Roger G. Mark, and Gari D. Clifford. “Robust heart rate estimation from multiple asynchronous noisy sources using signal quality indices and a Kalman filter.” Physiological measurement 29.1 (2007): 15.

The implementation itself is based on:

Behar, J., Oster, J., Li, Q., & Clifford, G. D. (2013). ECG signal quality during arrhythmia and its application to false alarm reduction. IEEE transactions on biomedical engineering, 60(6), 1660-1666.

Parameters

peaks – Annotation of the reference peak detector (Indices of the peaks). If peaks are not given, the peaks are calculated with epltd detector, the test peaks are calculated with xqrs detector.

Returns F1

The ‘bsqi’ score, between 0 and 1.

epltd()[source]¶

This function calculates the indexes of the R-peaks with epltd peak detector. :return: indexes of the R-peaks in the ECG signal.

notch(notch_freq)[source]¶

The notch function applies a notch filter in order to remove the power line artifacts. :param notch_freq: The frequency of the power line in the country where the signal was captured, usually the frequency is 50Hz (EUR) or 60Hz (US). :return: the filtered ECG signal

xqrs()[source]¶

src.pebm_pkg.FiducialPoints¶
